;Cultural relics and cultural heritage are non-renewable and irreplaceable outstanding Chinese civilization resources. The current Cultural Relics Protection Law was promulgated in November 1982. It has been revised five times and was comprehensively revised in 2002. Cultural relics work in the new era is facing new situations and new tasks. Some new situations and new problems have emerged in the field of cultural relics protection. In order to adapt to the needs of the development of cultural relics undertakings, revisions are urgently needed.

;

;On October 20, the revised draft of the Cultural Relics Protection Law was submitted to the sixth meeting of the Standing Committee of the 14th National People’s Congress for its first review. The revised draft implements the decisions and arrangements of the Party Central Committee and reflects the new requirements for cultural relics work in the new era; insists on putting protection first and further improves the cultural relics protection and management system; properly handles the relationship between protection and utilization and promotes the rational use of cultural relics; takes multiple measures simultaneously to increase Increase penalties and severely crack down on illegal acts that destroy cultural relics.

;In "Historical Records", among the aristocratic families that record the rise and fall of various vassal states, Wei State is known for its civil strife. The paragraph goes on and on, and Confucius's sentence "You must also correct your name" comes from it. Among them, the one most criticized by historians is the so-called Xuanjiang Rebellion.

;

;Xuan Jiang is a famous beauty. She is the daughter of Duke Xi of Qi and the wife of Duke Xuang of Wei. The overlord Duke Huan of Qi is her brother, and the famous Lady Xu Mu is her daughter. She is regarded as a specimen of beauty's misfortunes. It is said that the five generations have been restless, and chaos started from Jiang.

;Duke Xuan of Wei had an affair with his concubine Yi Jiang and gave birth to his son Ji. Make him a prince and marry Qi's daughter for him. Before they got married, Duke Xuan heard that Qi's daughter was stunningly beautiful. He fell in love with her in a second and was so flirtatious that he immediately cut off her husband and took over the house without any worries, so that he could marry someone else for the prince. Qi Nu gave birth to sons Shou and Shuo.

;

;Hou Yijiang committed suicide because he fell out of favor. The daughter of Qi, also known as Xuan Jiang, who became the first wife, and her son Shuo slandered Duke Xuan and framed the prince. Duke Xuan was dissatisfied, so he ordered the prince to go to Qi as an envoy and sent people to intercept and kill the prince on the way.

Later, Duke Xiang of Qi led the princes to attack the guards on the king's order, Qian Mou fled, and Duke Hui was restored to power. Duke Xiang of Qi asked Xuan Jiang to remarry Ji's other brother Wan, and they gave birth to three sons and two daughters. ;According to the website of the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection and the State Supervision Commission, the second round of inspections of the 20th Central Committee will carry out regular inspections of party committees (party groups) of 31 units; inspections will be carried out on the party groups of the National Railway Administration and the party groups of China Railway Group. look back".

;The 31 companies regularly inspected include 5 government departments, namely the Ministry of Science and Technology, the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology, the State-owned Assets Supervision and Administration Commission, the State Administration of Science, Technology and Industry for National Defense, and the State Tobacco Monopoly Administration. Another 26 central enterprises were included in the inspection list, focusing on FAW, Dongfeng, Baowu Steel, etc.

;

;According to the division of labor, during this round of inspections, the Fifth Central Inspection Team was responsible for "looking back" at the two units. The team leader was Geng Changyou, who is currently the director of the Cadre Bureau of the Central Propaganda Department.

;

;

;Most of the 24 inspection team leaders who have been stationed in the inspected units are cadres from the discipline inspection and supervision system.

;

;The leader of the Central First Inspection Team stationed in China Minmetals Corporation, China Aluminum Corporation of China, and China Mineral Resources Corporation is Cui Peng, who is currently the leader of the Discipline Inspection and Supervision Team of the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection and the National Supervisory Committee in the National Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference.

;

He is currently the leader of the Discipline Inspection and Supervision Team of the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection and the National Supervisory Commission at the National People's Congress. ;

;

;

This was also the first time in nearly 6 months. In 2016, the central government once again conducted mobile inspections.

;

;

;In the first round of inspections of the 20th Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, many central management officials of the inspected units were dismissed, including Li Xiaopeng, former chairman of China Everbright Group Co., Ltd., Zhou Qingyu, vice president of China Development Bank, China Everbright Tang Shuangning, former chairman of the group, Wang Yongsheng, former vice president of China Development Bank, Du Zhaocai, former deputy director of the State Sports General Administration, Xu Wenrong, former deputy general manager of PetroChina, etc.

;

; Fri, 20 Oct 2023 22:25:05 +0800 AI生成书籍泛滥：谁在制造“假书”？http://www.infzm.com/contents/258953
;;2023-10-20 21:00:00;
;

;;

;

;Amazon's self-publishing system allows anyone to self-publish and sell books on Amazon. This provides a loophole for the proliferation of AI-generated books. ;(Visual China/Photo);

;

;"Who is writing my biography?" 

;

;Dang Luo Li When Ciaran Jones discovered a biography of himself on Amazon, he had a strange question. He flipped through part of the book and it showed that he lived in an academic family, his father was an affable scholar and his mother was a teacher. The book is almost comparable to his own memoirs, except that the information in it is "total fantasy", he told the Guardian.

;

;In fact, Rory's father is a BBC television director, and his mother also works at the BBC. One day, he discovers the emotional stories of his parents in a shoebox containing letters, and thus uncovers the truth about his family's history. These stories are recorded in his real memoirs.

;

;As for the biography about him, Rory had never heard of the biographer, but he soon discovered that the book was generated by AI.

;

;Lori’s experience is not an isolated one. According to multiple foreign media reports, AI-generated books are flooding Amazon. These books range from biographies, cookbooks, popular science books to travel guides, etc. Some of the misinformation in some of these books can even be life-threatening.

;

;The New York Mycological Society (NYMS) publicly stated that many AI-generated mushroom foraging popular science books on Amazon and other e-commerce platforms contain many erroneous descriptions, which may mislead the public into eating poisonous mushrooms, "meaning of life and death."

;

;;“A;;I;;has crushed Amazon”;

;

;In June, writer Caitlin Lynch posted on social platforms, pointing out that among the top 100 best-selling Amazon teen contemporary romance e-books, only 19 are normal books, and the rest are AI-generated "nonsense."

;

;She also attached a screenshot of a book called "Waiting for You to Love Me", with a black and white photo of a seagull on the cover. Previously, the book was ranked No. 90 on Amazon's top 100 bestsellers list in the Teen Contemporary Romance category. The two one-star reviews below also pointed out that it is a book generated by AI.

;

;"AI has defeated Amazon." Lynch wrote in a tweet.

;

;According to a report by the New York Times in August, travel guides have also become one of the main categories where AI books are flooding. In March, traveler Amy Korsky purchased a travel guide on Amazon for her upcoming trip to France. When she entered a few search keywords "travel", "guidebook" and "France", a top-ranked "France Travel Guide" caught her attention.

;

;According to the author page, the author of the book, Mike Steves, is a "famous travel writer." There are more than a hundred five-star reviews on the book's interface, and the guide also promises itineraries and recommendations from locals. So Amy Kolsky placed the order.

;

;To her disappointment, when she received the book, she found that the descriptions inside were vague, the text was repetitive, and the itinerary lacked an itinerary that looked like it had been copied and pasted from Wikipedia. She returned the book.

;

;The New York Times discovered that things are not simple. They were unable to find any previously published works by the so-called "author" of the book. Even the photo of the "author" on the interface looked strange, such as abnormal elements near the ears, crooked clothes, etc., which seemed to be photos generated by AI.

;

;Based on the results of the AI ​​detection tool Originality.ai, Mike Steves' book was almost certainly AI-generated. In addition, the New York Times found that AI-generated books have also begun to penetrate cooking, programming, medicine, gardening and many other categories.

;

;In many media reports, AI-generated books not only bring misleading information to readers, but also cause great trouble to real authors. In August, writer Jane Friedman stated on her blog that some “junk books” had been uploaded to Amazon. Her name was listed in the author column, but she did not write these books. They were extremely misleading. Most likely generated by AI.

;

;She has been blogging since 2009. Many of the contents are public and can be used for AI model training. So when she reads the first page of these "fake books," it's like she's reading a self-generated ChatGPT reply. To make matters worse for her, these "fake books" were added to her Goodreads profile, which could easily be misleading.

;

;After she complained about this on social platforms, some authors responded that they had had similar experiences. "People keep telling me they bought my new book and it has my name on it but I never wrote it," one author said. Some authors reported 29 books with similar situations in just one week.

;

;"The scary thing is that this can happen to anyone with a reputation, a status, a need, and someone sees a way to profit from it." In an interview with CNN , said Jane Friedman.

;

;;"Effectively allowing 'junk books' to exist";

;

;Amazon after Rory discovered that his biography was AI-generated Sent him an email with a recommendation that said, "You might like this book." This made Rory angry that Amazon's algorithm thought this was a book he wanted.

;

; "They are essentially allowing 'junk books' to exist and recommending them to the people who hate them the most," Rory told the Guardian. Although Amazon later removed the book, many titles passed through a filtering system designed to weed out low-quality books.

;

;In fact, the appearance of many AI-generated books on the Amazon platform has a lot to do with the abuse of its own self-publishing system KDP (Kindle Direct Publishing). In 2007, Amazon created KDP to allow anyone to self-publish and sell books on Amazon. Currently, it offers more than 45 language options.

;

;On the Amazon KDP platform, authors can freely choose to self-publish e-books or paper books. After completing the upload process of self-published books, Amazon can pass the review and sell them in about 72 hours. Self-publishing a book on this platform is free, however, if publishing a physical book, the printing costs are deducted from the royalties earned from each book sale. Generally speaking, authors can receive royalties of up to 60% for paper books and 35% or 70% for e-books.

;

;In addition, with the development of artificial intelligence technology, many tutorials using AI to generate books have appeared on platforms such as YouTube and TikTok. Their topics range from a wide range of topics, and many users can quickly master AI generation from them. book method, coupled with the convenience and benefits of Amazon’s self-publishing function, it is difficult to avoid the abuse of this function for AI book publishing and sales.

;

;In September, Amazon introduced new rules and guidelines on its KDP community page after receiving complaints from many authors. The new regulations require authors to answer the system’s questions about whether the work is generated by artificial intelligence when publishing their work. In its content guide section, Amazon has also added content about AI, including definitions of “AI-generated” and “AI-assisted.”

;

;According to the "Guardian" report, due to concerns about artificial intelligence, Amazon introduced new rules that limit self-publishers to publish a maximum of three books per day.

;

;But even though the new regulations have been released, some impacts have already been caused. In the wake of the Jane Friedman scandal, books bearing her name were removed from Amazon and her Goodreads profile. But the process wasn't smooth, and Amazon initially refused to stop selling the books. Jane Friedman believes it was ultimately her popularity and reputation in the writing and publishing world that prompted Amazon to pull the books.

;

;“With the deluge of AI-powered content now posted on Amazon, sometimes with misleading or fraudulent attribution to authors, how can working authors be expected to spend time every week for the rest of their lives policing this? What's the content?" she asked.

;

;And even if those books no longer appear on her Amazon or Goodreads pages, their impact remains. Jane Friedman wrote on her blog: "Unfortunately, even if you remove these crazy books from your official profile, they will still be with your name...and you have no idea about it. But there is nothing we can do."

; Fri, 20 Oct 2023 21:25:04 +0800 毕业生求职，“我全都要”容易实现吗？http://www.infzm.com/contents/258810
;;2023-10-20 20:00:00;
;

;Affected by the economic environment and the number of graduates, the employment situation of college students graduating this year is severe. Although my friend Xiaoyan, a recent graduate student, received several offers (job opportunities), he was not happy at all, but became even more anxious. After some inquiries, he found out that none of these jobs seemed to meet the standards of his ideal job. How to choose a suitable job is a question that every graduate needs to think about.

;

;In the field of economics, there is a famous "Mundell's Impossible Triangle". This theory is that the country cannot simultaneously satisfy the independence of monetary policy, the stability of exchange rates, and the free flow of capital, and can only choose two of them at most. Similarly, in the job market, I think there is a similar "impossible triangle" law. It involves three conditions: salary level, work platform and relative stability of a job. It is difficult to achieve at the same time, and only two of them can be met at most.

;

;Let me briefly introduce the basic information of this friend: Xiaoyan comes from a rural family in a provincial capital in the northwest. He graduated from a 211 university with a bachelor's degree and a doctorate from a well-known 985 university in Beijing, with excellent grades; he published many publications during his studies. He has written SCI papers, participated in many national-level projects, and won many high-level competition awards. The three offers he got each have clear characteristics. His first job was as an official in the national ministries and commissions. He had a household registration, a good job platform, and a relatively high social status. However, his income level was in a first-tier city like Beijing, and there might not be much left after excluding expenses. Faced with the high housing prices, he was more than satisfied. The second job belongs to a monopoly institution in the industry, with a staff and a guaranteed income, but the platform is average, and there are more restrictions on job-hopping in the future; the third job is in a 211 university in my hometown, with a high level of scientific research platform and strong academic strength. The job is rich and the working hours are relatively free. The only drawback is that with the reform of universities and institutions, this job has no establishment and the employment period assessment pressure is high. He is worried that in the future he will face the outcome of promotion or resignation.

;

;Although Xiaoyan’s final choice has not yet been determined, I suggest that when he is looking for a job, his first priority is to learn to lower his expectations for a specific factor, rather than falling into a "I want it all" situation. As far as these three jobs are concerned, if he prefers a stable working environment within the system, he should probably lower his salary expectations. The first job may be the best choice; if he pursues better salary and treatment, he needs Compromise on the requirements of the work platform, so that the second job may be more suitable; if you yearn for a better scientific research platform and are interested in academic development, Xiaoyan can try to be less optimistic about the establishment of this indicator and challenge the third university teaching position. The job is not bad either.

;

;In short, the moon waxes and wanes, and work also has its flaws. For most graduating college students, the jobs they find basically conform to the "impossible triangle" law. Therefore, when necessary, we need to identify the needs and learn to make trade-offs, so that we can feel less anxious and face the severe employment environment calmly.

;

;(The author is a doctoral graduate in 2023)

;While in Aomori, of course I had a destination - go to Kaneki to see Dazai Osamu's former residence "Seiyangkan", and also went to Towada to visit the famous Towada Museum of Art. As for Basho's whereabouts, it has to reach a climax after this cycle.

;

;We turned around from north to south, took the bus from Aomori to Sendai, and then transferred to the main route to Matsushima Kaigan Station.

;

;Bajiao chants: "On a summer moonlit night in Songdao, the clear water is my clothes."

;

;Basho and Zeng Liang’s trip to Oshu, he said, was purely a whim, so he didn’t care about Wu Tianbai’s hatred. This whim was mentioned in his preface, because the Moon of Songdao appeared in his heart, tempting him to go on the road.

;

;Wu Tian's white hair is a reference to Bai Juyi's "I arrived in Dongluo on the 9th last year, and I came to Wuxiang on the 9th this year. The hair on both sides was white for a while, and the chrysanthemums in three places were the same color." , "Shoes fragrant with Chu ground flowers" all mean that the journey is long and difficult.

;

;;

;

;Matsushima is located in Miyagi-gun, Miyagi Prefecture, northeastern Japan. It is a scenic spot in Matsuo Basho's "Song Pillow" and is named after the pine trees planted all over the islands. ;(Photo courtesy of the author);

;

;Songdao is named after the pine trees planted all over it. The ancient Japanese traditional color name is pine leaf color. As the name suggests, the color of pine leaves is a dark green that is evergreen all year round. Among the traditional Japanese colors, there are several colors related to pine leaves, including sea pine color, which is a green that is close to black; and sea pine brown, which is a dark green mixed with brown and yellow, which is a calm and pretty green. Then there are sea pine blue, yellow sea pine tea, blue sea pine tea, etc., which in my opinion are various derivatives of pine leaf color.

;

;In "Oku no Homichi", Basho would occasionally note that he had reached a certain "singing pillow". The word "Utabu" means a place of interest that has appeared in Japanese Waka since ancient times. At the top of Japan's singing pillow, there are three scenic spots: Amanohashidate, Matsushima and Itsukushima (also called Miyajima). These three major attractions have been famous since the early Edo period. For me, Matsushima feels more literary because of Basho's description in "Oku no Hosomichi". Basho's "aphasia" was particularly interesting. He shouted, "Matsushima! Ah! Ah! Matsushima! Matsushima!"

;

;;

;

;The dry landscape garden of Zuiam Temple. ;(Photo courtesy of the author);

;

;Matsushima is a group of islands in the bay, Miyagi-gun, Miyagi Prefecture, northeastern Japan. It is composed of 260 small islands, large and small. They are named because they are covered with black pine and red pine. The four colors here are blue waves, white sand, limestone, and green pine. The colors are quite bright and harmonious.

;

;On October 30, 2019, Wei Dong, Yan Ning and I set off from Hachinohe in Aomori to Matsushima. Take the bus from Hachinohe Station to Sendai, then transfer to the main line to Matsushima Kaigan Station. A very small station platform stands in the middle of the railway. When we arrive at night, the biting cold wind blows from all sides of the platform. After all, it is already autumn. The sun is warm during the day, but disappears at night. We quickly got on the shuttle bus between the hotel and the station, turned a hill, and arrived at the hotel "Daguanzhuang".

;

;A large rectangular building lying on its back, with a huge lobby extending to both ends of the building. This large-scale resort hotel is almost identical and can be found in Hakone and Hokkaido. I highly doubt it was done by a designer. When you see a hotel of this size, you know how popular Songdo is.

;

;When you enter Songdo at night, you can’t see much. When you wake up in the morning and open the curtains, you will be greeted by a 180-degree sea view. Beautiful indeed. Her pure and simple beauty is suitable for people like Basho who are in a light and lonely state of mind. Basho also lives in Songdao facing the sea, on the second floor (we live higher than him on the third floor). He said, “Opening the window and facing the sea, the so-called traveling and sleeping in the wind and clouds, the wonderful feeling is indescribable. ”

;

;I carry "The Secret Path of the Oku" with me. When I arrived at Songdao, I read the chapter about "Songdao" in the book carefully. Basho sighed, "According to old legend, Fusang ranks first in the scenery of Songdao, and its coverage is not inferior to that of Dongting and West Lake. From the southeast, the sea enters the bay, and within three miles of the bay, it surges like the tide of Zhejiang. There are countless big and small islands, and the towering ones point directly to the sea. Outside the sky, prostrate ones are crawling on the waves. Either two layers overlap, or three layers are piled up; the islands on the left and right are either separated or connected; those with burdens and those with hugs are like loving children and grandchildren. The pines are lush, the tide is blowing, the wind is blowing, the branches and leaves The curves are natural, but appear to be the result of manipulation. The scenery is natural, with the appearance of a beautiful woman condensing her makeup. Could it be that the mountains were only made by the gods in ancient times? Who can use the colorful brushes of the heavens to achieve their beauty? Really?" (Translated by Zheng Qingmao)

;

;Bajiao has never been to China, but he is not reluctant to borrow the scenery of China. Through reading Chinese classics and paintings, ancient Japanese literati became quite familiar with and intimate with Chinese scenic spots such as the West Lake, Dongting Lake, and Qianjiang Tide. A matter of course.

;

;In the winter of 2018, my friends and I visited the Sumio Goto Museum of Art in Furano. I vaguely remember that he seemed to have a painting of Songdao, and it was a very long painting. I remember that I took a photo (Special note, many art museums in Japan are not allowed to take photos of exhibits, or can only take photos of some of the exhibits. I strictly abide by this rule. Photography is allowed for all exhibits in the Goto Juno Museum of Art) ). In November 2019, after returning home from a trip to Oshu, I turned on my computer to check, and I found this painting. I was very surprised. Isn’t this the view we saw from our room in Daikanso? I think Goto Juno stayed at Daikanso when he visited Matsushima, and it was one of the rooms on the third floor of our row facing the sea. This painting by Juno Goto was painted in 1987 and is called "Morning on Matsushima".

;

;;

;

;Autumn leaves at Entsu-in Temple, an affiliated temple of Zuigan-ji Temple. ;(Photo courtesy of the author);

;

;At that time, I stood in front of the window in the early morning and looked at the Matsushima sea view in front of me, and I thought of the Japanese cultural essayist In a passage from Hakushu Masako, she said, "Japan is an isolated island in the East, and the good and the bad are all in the word 'iso'. This isolated island is like a wind-swept corner of world culture. No matter what it is, as long as it passes through the hands of the Japanese, it will It will transform into something more indescribable, delicate, and dense.” I agree with this statement. There is no clear distinction between cultural forms, but there are completely different differences in rhythm, speed, and texture. Japanese culture is a condensed representation of world culture. Strong winds and waves transported various cultures to this island country in the Far East, and that's where it ended. Then, after being eliminated and transformed, they were condensed into a crystallized cultural form. Its static and density are completely different from mainland culture and corridor culture. The wind and waves stop here, but they are condensed in it, like a drop of amber between heaven and earth.

;

;Looking at the scenery of Songdao in front of the window, I suddenly remembered these. During the trip, generally, abstract words will continue to stimulate my thinking, while visual beauty will make me quite distracted. Songdo is an exception. It seems that this is indeed an unusual Songdo.

;

;In "The Small Path of the Oku", Basho's disciple Zeng Liang recited a haiku, "On the pine island, the cuckoo should use the crane's body to sing throughout the bay." This haiku was engraved. The stele was erected at the entrance of Zuiyan Temple, juxtaposed with the "Bajiao stele".

;

;The core of Songdo is Zuiam Temple. Basho and Zeng Liang visited Ruiyan Temple in the summer, and they thought it was peaceful and peaceful. We arrived in mid-autumn, and the tranquility was still there, with the subtle yellow and red colors of autumn mixed in with it. The smell of the sky must be completely different. The sky in all four seasons is really wonderful, equally clear and high, but the autumn sky is more profound and vague, like a pair of eyes with deeper sockets, which is different from the other three seasons. Starting from Sendai Station, I saw Matsushima red foliage tourism promotion posters posted all the way. They were overwhelmingly popular. The poster selects the red leaves of Zuigan Temple, or to be precise, the red leaves of Entsuin Temple, an affiliated temple of Zuigan Temple. The courtyard of Yuantongyuan is winding and graceful. It is a courtyard specially prepared for autumn. It is planted with maple trees, which will be full of red in late autumn. What was it like when we arrived? Take the marathon as an analogy. The starting gun of Hongfeng has already sounded. Some runners have already rushed out, but the huge team is still at the starting point. Imagine that as soon as we walked away, the red leaves in Yuantongyuan would start running wildly on a large scale until the whole garden was burning. It would be impossible not to feel a little sad.

;

;Zuigan Temple is an important temple of the Rinzai Sect. It was built in 828 AD. There is a room in the temple where Emperor Meiji once stayed, which is specially marked. After walking around the main hall and cloisters along the tour route, my attention was focused on the garden.

;

;Once the autumn light settles, it is gray-blue. Especially in the morning.

;

;After returning from Songdo, I often looked at the photos of the dry landscape garden at Zuiganji Temple. A wonderful scene separated by light. In the shadows, the white sand turns into a clear gray-blue. There are tiny wind and thunder in the wrinkles of the sand. The dark and light moss has a wonderful sense of exquisiteness. Beyond the shadows, in the strong light, the white walls and rocks, and the pine trees rolling down the cliff outside the temple, with the cluster of red leaves as the boundary, have lost their tension here and calmed down. But this stillness seems to be broken at any time, if the light changes slightly. As a result, those watching couldn't help but hold their breath. Therefore, it is right to freeze it into a photo.

;

;Art philosopher Professor Arthur Danto has studied Basho very well and believes that the texture of Basho haiku is "quiet, concise, as crystal clear and cool as a diamond". He once said that he wanted to be like Basho. Basho's journey is a pilgrimage to art, nature and the heart. He is humorous, self-deprecating, proud and lonely, but has a strong sense of humility. He regards his ancestors, nature and the very act of tapping the ground with his feet. They all have very pious thoughts. His practice has been successfully completed in the process of practice.

;

;Professor Danto once said it well. He said, "...Bashō, as an individual, exists in such a reality where the expression of personality and the disappearance of personality are unified. It is neither worldly nor independent. So out of the world; as he mocked himself, he was like a bat, neither a mouse nor a bird, but a hybrid shape-shifting creature between two animal states of existence. I was always moved by his travel notes . These travel notes are a symbol of the restlessness in his body. He always starts from a feeling or a hope for the end, with no intention of returning, in order to seek some ultimate escape. In the end, he discovers that escape itself is an achievement."< /p>;

;As for Basho, I once said that I regard him as a literary lover. In other words, I want to be like him.

;

;With the arrival of the rainy season, the incidence of malaria on the African island of Sao Tome has begun to rise. Guangzhou University of Traditional Chinese Medicine went to Sao Tome Huang Xinan, leader of the Dome-Príncipe Artemisia annua anti-malarial expert team, is increasingly busy.

;

;On the morning of October 16, 2023, shortly after it rained, he and his colleagues set off from downtown Sao Tome in a pickup truck and walked on the dirt road to Diogo Nunez (Diogo Nunez). Nunes) village. There, expert team teachers guided center employees to collect samples door-to-door to screen for potential cases.

;

;;

;

;Under the guidance of Chinese anti-malarial experts, staff went door-to-door to collect samples and screen for potential cases. ;(Photo courtesy of interviewee);

;

;On the outskirts of Nadi, Fiji, 85-year-old farmer Kumar is still in good spirits. On the 16th, he drove a small truck and brought back a load of Juncao oyster mushroom waste from the China-aided Juncao Technology Demonstration Center in Fiji. This waste mushroom material can be used as organic fertilizer for fruits and vegetables on the farm. Two months ago, under the guidance of Chinese Juncao technical experts, Kumar was still planting Juncao on the landslide on the farm's river bank to control the worsening water and soil erosion.

;

;Since the "Belt and Road" initiative was proposed, one after another "small but beautiful" projects that benefit people's livelihood have been implemented in countries along the initiative. Combining its own development experience and technological advantages, it provides Chinese solutions for local poverty alleviation, public health and environmental governance.

;

;;

;

;Kuma, an 85-year-old farmer in Nadi, Fiji, uses waste mushroom material as organic fertilizer for fruits and vegetables on the farm. ;(Photo courtesy of interviewee);

;

;"Juncao" and "Artemisia annua"

;

;For many For Fijians, Juncao is the "magic grass".

;

;At the Juncao planting base of the Juncao Technology Demonstration Center in Fiji, you can see these "guests" who have traveled across the ocean. These giant grasses are several meters long, with thick stems, wide leaves and well-developed root systems. Even the tallest people in the crowd feel as if they are walking into a reed marsh as soon as they enter the grassland, and they are instantly overwhelmed by the green.

;

;Local people often pronounce Juncao as Junkao according to their English pronunciation habits. In fact, Juncao technology is an original technology that China has completely independent intellectual property rights. Until now, the international English name of Juncao is "Juncao" in Chinese pinyin. In 2001, China's first foreign aid Juncao technology demonstration base was built in Papua New Guinea. So far, this technology has been promoted to more than 100 countries and regions around the world.

;

;On March 22, 2023, the China-Pacific Island Countries Juncao Technology Demonstration Center was unveiled and launched in Fiji. Lin Xingsheng, an expert at the National Juncao Engineering Technology Research Center of Fujian Agriculture and Forestry University, came to Fiji in January this year. Since then, his tasks have become even heavier.

;

;“In Fiji, Juncao can be used as high-quality feed for livestock and poultry, and can also be used to cultivate edible fungi—traditionally, it is a high-quality culture material for growing mushrooms.” He told Southern Weekend reporters that their Work includes production, scientific research, demonstration, training, promotion, etc. Since the implementation of Juncao technology in Fiji in 2014, more than 2,300 local Juncao technical talents have been trained, more than 700 farmers have grown Juncao mushrooms, and more than 1,000 farmers have developed Juncao farming, ending Fiji’s inability to The history of mushroom production.

;

; "Juncao is full of treasures and can be used for many purposes." Lin Xingsheng said that in addition to "replacing wood with grass" as a culture substrate for edible and medicinal fungi, Juncao can also be used as a culture medium for cattle and sheep. and other livestock feed, effectively alleviating the dry season feed shortage problem in the arid western Fiji area and promoting the development of local animal husbandry. In addition, Juncao grows quickly and has a well-developed root system. It can also be used to prevent local soil erosion and improve saline-alkali land. Planting one hectare of giant fungus in Fiji can absorb more than 100 tons of carbon dioxide, which is an effective way to combat climate change.

;

;At the end of August 2023, with the help of Lin Xingsheng and other experts, Juncao was planted on the river bank of the farm of Kumar’s family, a local in Nadi. Just over a month has passed, and clumps of green grass have grown on the originally bare steep slopes. After entering the tillering stage and jointing stage, Juncao will grow faster and faster. Lin Xingsheng is "confident".

;

;“Soil and water loss was very serious on the landslide before. When it rained, the sediment would rush into the river. Planting Juncao can effectively solidify the soil and store water. This is why we carry out Juncao slope protection and bank protection in Fiji to prevent soil and water loss. One of the demonstration sites of ecological governance." Lin Xingsheng said.

;

;Compared with the tall Juncao, Artemisia annua looks particularly "weak". The ancient name of Artemisia annua is "裣", which means "grass that treats malaria" and was first recorded in "Shen Nong's Materia Medica".

;

;More than 1,700 years ago, Ge Hong, a Taoist priest and medical scientist in the Eastern Jin Dynasty, left a record of artemisia annua against malaria in "Emergency Prescriptions" - "A handful of artemisia annua, soak it with two liters of water, and wring it out. Just take it." This 15-character ancient prescription has inspired generations of Chinese medicine practitioners.

;

;Tu Youyou, a researcher at the China Academy of Chinese Medical Sciences, was also inspired by this, changing the extraction method from high temperature to low temperature, and finally successfully discovered artemisinin, which has benefited millions of malaria patients.

;

;On June 30, 2021, the World Health Organization announced that China had passed the malaria elimination certification. According to disclosed data, the number of local primary cases of malaria in China has dropped from 30 million per year before the founding of New China to "zero for four consecutive years."

;

;With the advancement of the Belt and Road Initiative, China’s anti-malarial experience with Artemisia annua has also been introduced to other countries in the world.

;

;Sao Tome and Principe (referred to as "Sao Tome and Principe") is an island country in the west of the African continent with a population of about 220,000. The year here is divided into dry season and rainy season. Among them, during the rainy season from October to May of the following year, the humid and high temperature weather is very conducive to the breeding of mosquitoes. Mosquitoes are an important vector for the spread of malaria.

;

;On October 17, Huang Xinan, an associate researcher at the Artemisia Research Center of Guangzhou University of Traditional Chinese Medicine, who is carrying out anti-malarial assistance in Sao Tome and Principe, told Southern Weekend reporters that while the rainy season has just begun, they must speed up monitoring and control. pace. Currently in Sao Tome, a village can be classified as an epidemic source village if there are more than 3 cases of malaria patients.

;

;On October 14, a hospital in Água Grande, São Tomé City, reported three malaria cases. On October 16, they deployed manpower to carry out a large-scale malaria epidemic prevention and control operation in key epidemic source villages. Screening.

;

;"Generally, we will determine the source village through feedback data from hospitals, epidemic control centers and other channels, and then work with malaria prevention team members to carry out case screening, drug distribution, mosquito disinfecting and other tasks." Huang Xinan said.

;

;In 2019, in Liberdade, Dashui District, São Tomé City, the China Artemisia annua anti-malarial project team adopted a "source elimination and malaria" program that prioritized removing the source of infection to conduct an anti-malarial pilot . Prior to this, this village with a population of more than 600 had 300 to 400 malaria cases every year. After three rounds of medication, the team continued to carry out measures such as monitoring the floating population and investigating the infection rate. During the long rainy season that followed for eight months, there were no local cases of malaria infection in Liberty Village.

;

;The success of the Free Village pilot has given the Sao Tome and Principe government and local WHO officials greater confidence in defeating malaria. Because of its immediate therapeutic effect, the Artemisia annua compound medicine distributed by the expert team was also called the "Oriental Miracle Medicine" by the villagers.

;

;;

;

;With the help of Chinese Juncao technical experts, Juncao was planted on the river bank of Kumar's farm. ;(Photo courtesy of interviewee);

;

;"Business opportunities" and connections

;

;The Juncao mushroom cultivation project is It brings business opportunities to local farmers.

;

;Lin Xingsheng, leader of the expert team of the China-aided Fiji Juncao Technology Demonstration Center, gave an example. The Fiji Juncao Center provides technical training to local farmers and provides fungus bags full of mycelium. After farmers receive the mushroom bags from the center, they can cultivate the mushrooms under the forest or in the shade of the shed by covering the soil with soil. They only need simple management measures such as simple watering and maintenance, lifting the film for ventilation, and the first crop of oyster mushrooms can be harvested in about 7-10 days. , you can have income.

;

;In Fiji, ordinary farmers only need to plant 10 square meters of Juncao oyster mushrooms in front of and behind their houses. If they plant 4 times a year, they can harvest 1,200 kilograms of fresh oyster mushrooms and earn 20,000 Fijian dollars. The equivalent of RMB is almost over 60,000 yuan.

;

;“This is much higher than the annual income of ordinary local farmers, so the locals call the Juncao project ‘quick money, easy money’ (money is easy and fast).” Lin Xingsheng said.

;

;In Rwanda, a country in central and eastern Africa, the economic benefits of growing mushrooms also attract ordinary farmers.

;

;Chen Xiaobin, leader of the expert team of China’s Juncao Technology Demonstration Center in Rwanda, told Southern Weekend reporters that Rwanda has a large population but little land and underdeveloped industry. Local workers have low incomes, with an average daily income of only 9 yuan. Through the simple and easy-to-operate Juncao technology, ordinary people only need a small piece of open land and basic care to grow cash crops that make money quickly.

;

;Compared with previous local mushroom growing technologies, China’s Juncao mushroom growing technology has low cost, high yield and easy operation, and is welcomed by many mushroom growers. In neighboring countries adjacent to Rwanda, such as Uganda and the Democratic Republic of the Congo, mushroom merchants also go to border trading points to purchase fresh mushrooms. The ever-expanding domestic and foreign market demand has also stimulated the enthusiasm of mushroom growers.

;

;In addition to growing mushrooms in mushroom bags, some people are also studying mushroom bag production technology to achieve "technical localization."

;

;In Nadi, Fiji, farmer Ashniel is an expert at growing mushrooms. Not only did he fully master the management technology of Juncao mushrooms, he also learned to produce mushroom bags independently. At the same time, he also modified a humidifier to adjust the humidity in the mushroom-producing place. The oyster mushrooms he grows have thick flesh and good quality, which not only attracts many people to visit and study, but is also favored by customers.

;

;In Rwanda, many locals who come for training are college students with higher education. After completing their studies, they started their own business and sold fungus bags to local farmers for a fee. According to preliminary statistics, there are about 50 local companies and cooperatives that independently produce mushroom bags. According to Chen Xiaobin, in Rwanda, Chinese Juncao technology is a symbol of high-quality mushrooms. Mushroom growers or mushroom bag manufacturers will rush to put the "Juncao Technology" label on their products when promoting their products.

;

;With the introduction of Juncao mushroom cultivation technology, Chinese mushrooms have also quietly integrated into the local food culture.

;

;Chen Xiaobin of the Rwanda Juncao Technology Demonstration Center said that every time when training students, teachers will arrange cooking classes to demonstrate various ways of eating mushrooms. "Such as deep-frying, stir-frying, mushroom soup, etc." After students read it, they will also make innovations based on local eating habits.

;

;In Fiji, mushroom growers process the mushrooms and add cassava flour and other materials to turn them into mushroom drinks. In Rwanda, Sambusa (the Chinese call it Triangle) is a traditional pasta made of dough and stuffing. Bao), in addition to regular fillings such as potatoes, beef, and onions, recently the hot-selling mushrooms have also been added.

;

;In the Eastern Highlands Province of Papua New Guinea (referred to as "PNG"), the first stop for "Juncao going overseas", the Juncao and upland rice industries have become the second and third largest industries in the region after coffee. three major agricultural industries.

;

;In early 2000, China's Fujian Province and Papua New Guinea's Eastern Highlands Province signed a sister province agreement, listing Juncao and upland rice technology as Fujian Province's assistance projects to Eastern Highlands Province.

;

;Lin Yingxing, leader of the expert team of China’s Juncao Technology Demonstration Base in Papua New Guinea, told Southern Weekend reporters that over the years, the Juncao project’s promotion area in Papua New Guinea, the number of participating farmers, training personnel, and experts have increased significantly. improve. Currently, subdivided projects such as Juncao mushroom cultivation, Juncao livestock husbandry, and upland rice cultivation have been promoted to many provinces in the country, benefiting more than 10,000 farmers.

;

;According to a report by the "PNG Courier" on October 4, 2023, this project has become a model for the "One Belt, One Road" cooperation between China and Papua New Guinea. The friendly relations between the new Eastern Highlands provinces played an important role.

;

;;

;

;In Nadi, Fiji, the oyster mushrooms grown by farmer Ashniel have thick flesh and good quality. They not only attract many people to visit and learn, but are also favored by customers. ;(Photo courtesy of interviewee);

;

;"Prescribe the right medicine to the case"

;

;According to WHO data in 2020, Among the six major regions in the world, Africa is the most severely affected by malaria. In 2020, the region accounted for 95% of the global total of malaria cases and 96% of the global malaria deaths. An estimated 80% of malaria deaths in the region occur among children under 5 years of age.

;

;In 2006, Deng Changsheng, an associate researcher at the Artemisia annua Research Center of Guangzhou University of Chinese Medicine, provided anti-malarial assistance in the African island nation of Comoros. He saw from preliminary survey data that at that time, about 60% of outpatient cases in medical institutions in Comoros were malaria. More than half of the hospitalized cases were malaria patients.

;

;“It can be said that malaria was the most troublesome health problem in this country at that time.” He said.

;

;In Comoros at that time, many residents were accustomed to collecting rainwater in cellars during the rainy season for use in the dry season. During field research, Deng Changsheng saw mosquito larvae crawling densely in the water cellars of many residents.

;

;Poor drinking water environment is undoubtedly one of the reasons for the spread of malaria. Even in recent years, the malaria situation in Africa is still not optimistic.

;

;Professor Song Jianping, director of the Artemisia annua Research Center of Guangzhou University of Chinese Medicine, told Southern Weekend reporters that in 2017, the team conducted random checks among about 150,000 people in the Est-Mono region of Togo, Africa. Among more than 2,000 people randomly checked, the infection rate among the sample population was as high as 80%.

;

;In addition to extremely high infection rates, many African countries have very weak anti-malarial medical systems.

;

;“Many African countries have a common problem, that is, there is no primary medical care, or there is an urgent shortage of emergency doctors.” According to Song Jianping, people with malaria are unable to seek medical treatment for various reasons after they develop symptoms. Some residents need to spend their own money for tests and high-priced drugs; some residents have inconvenient transportation and cannot reach regular hospitals. If it cannot be detected in time, it will be impossible to achieve the effect of early treatment and early prevention.

;

;For many years, Chinese artemisia annua anti-malarial experts, including Song Jianping’s team, have launched artemisia annua anti-malarial campaigns in African countries.

;

;In Comoros, his team implemented a campaign of universal administration of artemisinin compound to eliminate the source of infection, curbing the country's malaria epidemic and achieving zero malaria deaths. In Papua New Guinea, only one year after the project was implemented, the average population infection rate was 0.07%, a decrease of more than 99%, and zero malaria deaths were achieved. In Sao Tome, the project team has gradually established a three-level anti-malaria system of "Ministry of Health - County - Village" in São Tomé and Principe. According to the malaria incidence rate and the number of outbreaks, targeted early intervention is carried out in high-incidence villages to suppress malaria outbreaks. Popularity.

;

;“Over the years, these programs have been verified by millions of people in many countries, and there is very rich clinical data. The data proves that the Chinese programs are effective and immediate. For compound artemisia annua anti- We are very confident in our plan to combat malaria," Deng Changsheng said.

;

;Song Jianping believes that malaria prevention and control is a complex and huge task. In terms of the drug itself, the compound artemisia annua antimalarial regimen has its own advantages.

;

;He said that the team is constantly optimizing the drug ratio in anti-malarial drugs so that it can maintain the advantages of artemisinin’s high cure rate while reducing adverse reactions and taking rounds as much as possible. Suitable for large-scale drug administration sites.

;

;“The incidence rate of adverse reactions of some drugs is as high as 20 to 30%, which can cause fear in patients. Low participation means low coverage, which cannot achieve prevention and treatment effects.” Song Jianping said.

;

;On the African continent, Nigeria and the Democratic Republic of Congo account for 70% of malaria cases in the world. Compared with island countries, the incidence rate here is higher, the infection level is more severe, the population is larger, and the population is more mobile. Implementation of the plan may require larger amounts of funds and greater coordination.

;

;Next, Song Jianping hopes to continue to develop more effective antimalarial drugs on the one hand, and on the other hand, extend the antimalarial experience to more areas. "In the future we hope to make a difference on the African continent," he said.
